emissions.closest_match_explanation: The ingredient '2 dl red wine' is directly matched to 'wine, red'. This is an exact match for the ingredient, aligning with rule 8.

The ingredient 'Oil' is a general term. Among the available options, 'olive oil' has the highest emission factor (5.9 kg CO2e / kg) compared to 'oil for frying' (2.8 kg CO2e / kg), 'sunflower oil' (2.8 kg CO2e / kg), and 'oil, rape seed (no eruca acid)' (3.3 kg CO2e / kg). According to rule 5, if multiple viable options have similar processing levels, the one with the highest emission factor should be chosen to ensure a conservative estimate.
